title: Introducing voice timbre attribute detection
author: Jinghao He (NERC-SLIP, University of Science and Technology of China), Zhengyan Sheng (NERC-SLIP, University of Science and Technology of China), Liping Chen (NERC-SLIP, University of Science and Technology of China), Kong Aik Lee (Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, The Hong Kong Polytechnic University), Zhen-Hua Ling (NERC-SLIP, University of Science and Technology of China), ...
relevance_why: This work directly addresses voice timbre, which is essential in audio processing, particularly in improving techniques for audio generation and restoration—areas that align with Haohe Liu's interests in text-to-audio generation and audio quality enhancement.
background: Voice timbre attribute detection involves comparing two speech signals to determine differences in perceived characteristics, which can improve automatic speech processing applications.
contribution: This paper introduces a novel task of voice timbre attribute detection to solve the challenge of measuring subjective timbre attributes in speech signals, achieving measurable detection of intensity differences across descriptor dimensions.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods in voice attribute modeling primarily focused on speaker recognition and identification without a systematic approach to timbre comparison.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves upon prior techniques by introducing a framework for assessing voice timbre attributes through comparative analysis of speaker embedding vectors.

key_innovation: The framework uses neural networks to compare timbre attributes derived from speech embeddings, allowing for more nuanced detection of speech qualities.
real_world_impact: The findings in this study could enhance applications like voice conversion, speech synthesis, and even emotional speech recognition, leading to more realistic and expressive audio technologies.
limitations: The study is dependent on the annotated VCTK-RVA dataset; thus, the generalizability to other datasets and languages remains to be fully assessed.

new_terms.timbre: **Timbre** refers to the quality or color of sound that distinguishes different types of sound production, such as voices or musical instruments.
new_terms.speaker embeddings: **Speaker embeddings** are vector representations of a speaker's voice characteristics, often used in speaker verification and recognition tasks.

open_sourcing: The VCTK-RVA dataset and open-source code are available at https://github.com/vTAD2025-Challenge/vTAD
